snippet: The group, the Electronic Privacy Information Center, says that only the nation’s highest court can address the “exceptional circumstances” created by the surveillance operation.
abstract: Privacy rights group Electronic Privacy Information Center plans to file an emergency petition with Supreme Court asking it to stop National Security Agency's domestic surveillance program that collects telephone records of millions of Americans.
lead_paragraph: The group, the Electronic Privacy Information Center, says that only the nation’s highest court can address the “exceptional circumstances” created by the surveillance operation.

headline.main: Privacy Group to Ask Supreme Court to Stop N.S.A.’s Phone Spying Program
headline.print_headline: Privacy Group to Ask Supreme Court to Stop N.S.A.’s Phone Spying Program
